long_description:
= RightScale App Cookbook (Beta)

== DESCRIPTION:

RightScale application server management cookbook (beta) 

This cookbook contains recipes that generally applicable to all application
servers.

== DETAILS:

== REQUIREMENTS:

Requires a VM launched from a RightScale managed RightImage 

== SETUP:
       
== USAGE:

Add the default recipe to tag your server as an appserver. This is used by 
servers (like databases) to identify their clients.

== KNOWN LIMITIATIONS:

recipes.app::request_loadbalancer_deny: Sends request to all application servers tagged with loadbalancer:app=<applistener_name> to deny connections from the caller's private IP address.  This should be run on a load balancer after disconnecting application servers or upon decommissioning.
recipes.app::default: Adds the appserver:active=true tag to your server which identifies it as an application server. This tag is used by database servers, for example, for opening firewall ports.
recipes.app::do_loadbalancers_allow: Allow connections from all load balancers within a given listener pool which are tagged with loadbalancer:lb=<applistener_name>.  This should be run on an application server before requesting connection to load balancers.
recipes.app::request_loadbalancer_allow: Sends request to all application servers tagged with loadbalancer:app=<applistener_name> to allow connections from the caller's private IP address. This should be run on a load balancer before attaching application servers.
recipes.app::do_loadbalancers_deny: Deny connections from all load balancers which are tagged with loadbalancer:lb=<applistener_name>. This can be run on an application server to deny connections from all load balancers within a given listener pool.
